column5: As some of you know from an earlier post, I had to cancel our trip down to Nantucket for Bluefin Tuna because of Hurricane Irene   ....it was actually a good decision because they had closed the Providence Rhode Island airport on Sunday and I would not have made it down in time to get on the boat yesterday...  So I puttered around the house and completed some outside chores which gave me the green light to head out on the river for a couple of hours last night before it got dark....I can't believe how short the days are getting!!......water temp dropped 5 degrees from last weekend with these cooler nights....  They're starting to fatten' up....
Great looking fish, congrats! The water is a lot calmer than what it would have been on the bluefin trail too.
Atta boy Steve, a chunky musky is better than some ole tuna any day   Very purty fish indeed !!
Great lookin fish!!! Hopeully, i will be getting out soon for some fall Musky hunting.
oooh she's a beaut. Casting? trolling? lure?
Still looking for my first muskie this year...  I guess it would help if I actually got out and fished for them!!!  Reports like this are giving me the itch....great fish!
Very nice fish and very nice set up!
Very nice fish! Congrats!   When you say River, which one are we talking about?  Keep your hooks sharp!
Nice work....I really gotta get the dust off the ol' muskie combo.  monsterfish....if you look at his location, it shows Ottawa River....I'll take a stab at that being the one
Johnnyb,  I'll go with your guess as well! hehe!  I'll blame that one on an early morning post. I hadn't had a coffee yet.  cheers  keep your hooks sharp!  Monster
nice fish... and looks like a nice day as well... talk about glass
Beauty photoshop job Steve !!  Nice fish!
That's a good one. Nice and fat

Thanks Lew!!....I love Muskie best but the thought of fighting a 1000lb tuna and then releasing it back into the ocean gives me chills....next year    Thanks mercman..the fun is just starting    Thanks Rizzo... fast trolling (5.3mph on the GPS) in deeper water (~25FOW) using a 10" crankbait    Thanks Cliff......get out there!   Thanks..   Ottawa River.....hooks are always touched up before they hit the water.    Bingo..   It was a beauty night for sure..thanks   Thanks Wayne..   They are definately starting to put the feed bag on..
